articles.author: Phuong Nguyen, Francesco Guarascio, Anshuman Daga
articles.description: VinFast's shares (VFS.O) soared in thin trading in their Nasdaq debut on Tuesday following the Vietnamese electric vehicle maker's $23 billion backdoor listing as the startup said it was likely to raise money from global investors within 18 months.
articles.title: VinFast's shares surge in Nasdaq debut for Vietnam EV maker

articles.author: Carolina Mandl
articles.description: Global hedge funds are "aggressively" selling Chinese stocks amid heightened concerns over the country's property sector and a weak batch of economic data, a Goldman Sachs report on Tuesday showed.
articles.title: Hedge funds dump Chinese stocks aggressively as growth outlook dims

articles.author: Rae Wee
articles.description: The yen languished near its weakest level in nine months on Wednesday and kept traders on alert for any signs of intervention, while mounting concerns over China's sputtering economy and gloomy outlook soured the mood in Asia.
articles.title: Yen treads on intervention zone; kiwi, Aussie dlrs hit by China woes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: United Auto Workers members have until Aug. 24 to vote to authorize strikes at the Detroit Three automakers if they don't have a new contract deal in hand by the time the current agreement expires in about 30 days, the union said on Tuesday.
articles.title: UAW presses for strike vote at Detroit Three automakers

articles.author: Sheila Dang
articles.description: Social media company X, formerly known as Twitter, delayed access to links to content on the Reuters and New York Times websites as well as rivals like Bluesky, Facebook and Instagram, according to a Washington Post report on Tuesday.
articles.title: Musk's X delays access to content on Reuters, NY Times, social media rivals

articles.author: Lucy Craymer
articles.description: New Zealand's central bank held the cash rate steady at 5.5% on Wednesday but slightly pushed out when it expects to start cutting the cash rate to 2025, which provided some support for the New Zealand dollar.
articles.title: NZ central bank sees cash rate on hold until 2025

articles.author: Anirban Sen
articles.description: Intel Corp (INTC.O) will walk away from its $5.4 billion deal to acquire Israeli contract chipmaker Tower Semiconductor Ltd (TSEM.TA) once the companies' contract expires later on Tuesday, according to people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Intel to walk away from $5.4 bln acquisition of Tower Semiconductor -sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea said that Travis King confessed to crossing into the North because of "inhuman maltreatment and racial discrimination within the U.S. Army", state media reported on Wednesday, the first public acknowledgement of the incident by Pyongyang.
articles.title: North Korea says Travis King wants refuge from mistreatment in US Army, state media reports

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump is likely to claim that his right to free speech and genuine concerns about voter fraud protect him from charges that he pressured Georgia officials to change the results of the 2020 election in his favor.
articles.title: Georgia indictment: How will Trump defend himself? Will it work?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Any Chinese military action in response to the stopovers in the U.S. by Taiwan Vice President William Lai would be an attempt by Beijing to interfere in the island's elections, Lai said during a trip to Paraguay.
articles.title: China military action to US stopover would be election interference, Taiwan VP says
